arts.ttl: 'We beat Aston Villa so we don't fear Celtic' - Inside the confident Club Brugge camp ahead of Champions League clash
arts.sum: Ferran Jutgla says Brugge are confident and don't fear Celtic

arts.ttl: Villa equalise TWICE against Palace but winless run continues
arts.sum: Ross Barkley’s late headed equaliser helped Aston Villa earn a 2-2 draw against Crystal Palace at Villa Park, although their winless run now stands at six matches in all competitions. Ismaila Sarr got the visitors off to a flying start with his first goal for the club on four minutes, as he slotted home on the break, though Ollie Watkins brought the hosts level in the 36th minute.

arts.ttl: Aston Villa ‘deserved more’ from Palace draw as winless run continues
arts.sum: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery admitted his side need to cut out the mistakes after drawing with Crystal Palace at home on Saturday. Ismaila Sarr opened the scoring after just three minutes, but Ollie Watkins cancelled it out in the 36th minute with his sixth Premier League goal of the season. But Villa went into […] The post Aston Villa ‘deserved more’ from Palace draw as winless run continues first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Unai Emery admits out-of-form Aston Villa need to cut out mistakes
arts.sum: Villa are without a win from their last six matches in all competitions.

arts.ttl: Glasner on Devenny goal and sensational support
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner praised his team’s fighting spirit after a positive performance in a thrilling draw at Villa Park, with Academy star Justin Devenny scoring his first goal for the club.

arts.ttl: Unai Emery rues Aston Villa 'mistakes' as another opportunity wasted against Crystal Palace
arts.sum: We are really convinced this is the way we played here at home this year in the Premier League, not getting three points but deserving in each match, more or less, to win. Aston Villa manager Unai Emery rued his side's mistakes after being held to a 2-2 draw with Crystal Palace at Villa Park.
Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner says he is "proud" of his team after drawing 2-2 at Aston Villa.
Unai Emery says Aston Villa will "correct mistakes" after coming from behind twice to earn a 2-2 draw against Crystal Palace and end their losing run.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner has mixed emotions after Crystal Palace’s draw at Aston Villa
arts.sum: “After they scored their equaliser, we still played forward and had a big chance at the end with Jeffrey Schlupp. The Eagles took the lead after four minutes when Jean-Philippe Mateta played through Ismaila Sarr and the former Watford man used his pace to stay ahead of Ian Maatsen and slot beyond Emiliano Martinez.

arts.ttl: Devenny on first goal: ‘It felt like slow motion’
arts.sum: Justin Devenny says he will remember his first Premier League goal ‘for the rest of my life’ as he earned Palace a point at Villa Park.
